MS black-edged: M's brother-in-law, Eduard Wehl, died on 11 February 1876. MS annotation by [Hector]: 'Ansd 2.10.76'. Letter not found. Melbourne

3/5/76.
M's letter was registered at the Geological Survey Office, Wellington, on 25 May 1876 and forwarded to Hector on 31 May.

Since a long time, dear Dr Hector, I intended to have written to you, but in reality nothing specially occurred for doing so, unless to offer my felicitation to your return,
Hector has been visiting Europe; see M to J. Hector, 28 July 1877 (in this edition as 77-07-28a). which gratulation now though tardily yet feelingly I do present.

I was also anxious to ask you, whether a few notes on N.Z. & Chath. Isl. plants would be acceptable for the new volume of the institute,
New Zealand Institute, Wellington. and if so by what time such brief memoranda must be sent.

I have never heard again of the fate of my "industrial plants" after Dr Pollen acknowledged the receipt of the corrected and supplemented copy.
See G. Cooper to M, 6 October 1874 (in this edition as 74-10-06b), and M to G. Cooper, 3 November 1874. Can you kindly tell me how the prospects are for this intended local N.Z. reissue. Surely 5000 copies, sent out all over N.Z ought to do permanent & extensive good, and that could be accomplished for about £200.
See M. to G. Cooper, 3 November 1874, and notes thereto. The proposed NZ edition of M's book was never published.
